title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates and adjusts the pay rates for various federal employees, including statutory pay systems, senior executives, judges, uniformed service members, and locality-based comparability payments. It sets effective dates for these rate adjustments to take effect starting January 1, 2015, and supersedes a previous related executive order.
potential_concerns: Adjustments to locality-based comparability payments may not fully reflect regional cost-of-living differences, potentially impacting federal employees disproportionately across geographic areas.
Pay rate increases for military personnel could lead to budgetary constraints affecting other aspects of military readiness and force structure.
Changes in pay scales for senior executives and judges may raise concerns about equity and justifications relative to lower-grade federal employees.
The implementation timing of pay adjustments may cause temporary payroll and administrative challenges affecting federal employees' financial planning.
Foreign Service Officers receiving updated pay rates might face challenges aligning compensation with overseas cost fluctuations, affecting recruitment and retention.
